newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: South Korea dismisses Pyongyang story on submarine.
newsitem.headline: South Korea dismisses Pyongyang story on submarine.

text.p: South Korea on Monday dismissed North Korea's explanation for the infiltration of a submarine last week as "not worthy of consideration".
A defence ministry spokesman told a news conference that Pyongyang was simply trying to defuse criticism by saying the vessel had drifted into Southern waters as a result of engine failure.

The North Korean explanation came in a statement carried by its official Korea Central News Agency. Pyongyang also demanded the return of the submarine and its crew, including the bodies of those killed.

"The North Korean explanation about the ship is nonsense. It is not worthy of consideration," the South Koran spokesman said. "It is nothing but North Korea's habitual, deceitful policy aimed at defusing criticism.
"The intrusion was a carefully planned infiltration," the spokesman added.
South Korean authorities believe 26 North Koreans came ashore from the submarine on Wednesday. Twenty have been shot and killed and one captured alive. A hunt is on for the remaining agents.
